channel.title: OnOptions
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from OnOptions, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: OK Go’s Damian Kulash on his secret to creative thinking
item.description: Damian Kulash, guitarist and lead singer of the rock band OK Go, is also kind of a creative director. His band has become world famous for its inventi...

item.title: Don’t Sweat the Stock Market’s Similarities to the Dot-Com Bubble
item.description: Big Tech companies in the AI era are far more profitable than those from the internet boom.

item.title: 80 housing markets cross a critical line—why that’s good for homebuyers
item.description: Want more housing market stories from Lance Lambert’s ResiClub in your inbox? Subscribe to the ResiClub newsletter . During the pandemic housing boom,...

item.title: This stunning new sculpture visualizes what climate change could do to the Earth
item.description: In the lobby of the MIT Museum in Cambridge, Massachusetts, an enormous sculpture made from thousands of feet of plastic twine falls from the ceiling....

item.title: Jamie Dimon says Trump’s efficiency drive isn’t enough to avert debt crisis: ‘Like most problems, it’s better to deal with it than let it happen’
item.description: Dimon stressed that only faster growth—unlocked by lighter regulation and freer trade—can restore balance to the U.S.’s debt-to-GDP ratio.

item.title: Mark Zuckerberg says he wants to ‘stay out of partisan politics’
item.description: Just weeks ago, Zuckerberg sat next to Trump at a White House dinner and pledged to invest $600 billion in the U.S. over the next four years.

item.title: These mini vinyl records might be your new favorite collectible
item.description: It’s the size of a coaster and looks like a toy, but when the needle hits its groove, it’s immediately clear that Tiny Vinyl is exactly what its name ...

item.title: How This AI Startup Could Help Businesses With Long-Range Weather Forecasting
item.description: Planette is harnessing AI to offer financial institutions and other firms intelligence about what the weather will do over the next few months.

item.title: Americans are losing their democracy in the same way they’ve failed to stop climate change—not with a bang but a whimper

item.title: Why Small Business Owners Should Adopt a Back to School Mindset at All Times
item.description: The best students are self-directed and develop their own learning tools and resources. Founders should take note.

item.title: Billionaire Mike Bloomberg was fired after dedicating 15 years of his career to Salomon Brothers—the next morning, he founded his media empire
item.description: Mike Bloomberg started at Salomon Brothers as a clerk making $9,000 a year, making his way up to partner, before getting the boot. He has no hard feel...

item.title: Self-made millionaire behind $4 billion Skims, Emma Grede says it all began with a cold call to Kris Jenner: ‘I have no imposter syndrome’

item.title: Oracle’s co-CEO structure will challenge the trope that having two chief executives rarely works
item.description: Also: All the news and watercooler chat from Fortune.

item.title: I Gave ChatGPT $500 to Invest in Stocks. Its Picks Surprised Me
item.description: When it comes to creative tasks like writing, GPT-5 feels like a major step backward. But, I’ve seen it excel at many pragmatic tasks.
